Shelei Pan, a 2020 LHWHS graduate, has helped put together a valuable resource for high school juniors and seniors who are interested in practicing medicine through a BS/MD program:

https://smartstartbsmd.wixsite.com/smartstart

Through this platform, students can talk directly to college students who currently are in dual degree BS/MD programs about their experiences. There also is a comprehensive list of programs available across the nation with links to their websites and applications, along with a blog that offers student perspectives on what it's like to be in a BS/MD program, as opposed to taking the traditional pre-med route.

We want to thank Dr. LaGarrett King for leading a two-day professional development opportunity at LHWHS focused on 'Rethinking Black History.'

Almost 200 Ladue Schools educators participated (a large majority not shown in the photo as they joined via live video stream!) and learned strategies on how they can be more intentional with teaching Black history.

Dr. King is associate professor of social studies education at the University of Missouri and a Founding Director at the Carter Center for K-12 Black History Education at the school.

No longer are men and boys encouraged to hide their feelings in unhealthy ways, as in generations past. The caring hands on shoulders reinforce this idea of solidarity.
Way to go, Luke!

Girls Swim/Dive team won the Class 1 State Championship for the first time in 43 years. Paige Mitchell won the 200 and 500 Freestyle and broke the state record for all classes in the 500 Freestyle.

All schools in the Ladue School District will be closing two hours early today (Friday, Jan. 11, 2019) due to the incoming winter storm. This schedule is different than early release days. Parents who pick up their children are asked to be as prompt as possible so staff can get home safely, as well. Please see below for specific closing times for today (Jan. 11, 2019):

- High School and Fifth Grade Center will dismiss at 12:30 p.m.
- Ladue Middle School will dismiss at 1:10 p.m.
- LECC/Full Day Preschool will dismiss at 1:15 p.m. (Half Day Preschool will dismiss at normal time.)
- Elementary schools will dismiss at 1:50 p.m.

All after school activities, including BASK are canceled. All district-sponsored activities and events are cancelled through Sunday, unless you are specifically advised otherwise.

Thank you for your understanding and stay safe out there!

The Ladue Schools football team won its first State Championship in school history with a victory over MICDS!

Ladue Schools fans turned out in force to support their team, and on the following Monday morning, the football team, along with the cheerleaders and the Laduettes, visited each school in the district to show their appreciation of everyone's support and to high-five the younger students. Students lined the halls to join in this opportunity to build community and celebrate the determination and success of these young men. When they returned to the high school, they were welcomed by parents, fans and the pep band!

Check out photos from the pep assembly and the school visits below!
